name: collector field area construction, solar thermal parabolic trough, 50 MW | collector field area, solar thermal parabolic trough, 50 MW | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/18122/documentation

This activity represents the construction of the collector field area for a 50 MW solar thermal parabolic trough power plant in Upington, South Africa. The total solar aperture area amounts to 600'000m2. The parabolic trough consists of the foundation of the individual collector elements, the steel construction, the collector mirrors, the receiver pipes and the drives of the collectors.;Total land use for the concentrated solar power plant is accounted for in the dataset "concentrated solar power plant construction, solar thermal parabolic trough, 50 MW". ;;This dataset is entirely based on the detailed life cycle inventory as presented in the dissertation report by ;Telsnig, Thomas. 2015. Standortabhängige Analyse und Bewertung solarthermischer Kraftwerke am Beispiel Südafrikas. Forschungsbericht. Band 123. ISSN 0938-1228. Institut für Energiewirtschaft und Rationelle Energieanwendung, Universität Stuttgart, Germany.

This activity starts with the construction of a precise square area for placement, operationalization and maintenance for the solar power plant.

This activity concludes with the construction of the parabolic troughs and painting the steel rods that are used to for staging and rotating the troughs.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The CSP plant represented in this dataset has been modelled specifically for South African conditions (see Telsnig 2015).
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The original data modelling a 250 MW power plant have been scaled down with parameter specific linear and non-linear equations to represent a 50 MW plant design.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
This dataset is entirely based on the detailed life cycle inventory as presented in the dissertation report by 
Telsnig, Thomas. 2015. Standortabhängige Analyse und Bewertung solarthermischer Kraftwerke am Beispiel Südafrikas. Forschungsbericht. Band 123. ISSN 0938-1228. Institut für Energiewirtschaft und Rationelle Energieanwendung, Universität Stuttgart, Germany. 

Further, data in Telsnig 2015 are not shown explicitely for the downscaled 50 MW parabolic trough power plant. This gap is filled in the ecoinvent report.

exchanges.description:
All steel types are assumed to be treated as reinforcing steel due to lack of other appropriate datasets in ecoinvent.  
For the time period 2003-2012, average steel recycling rate in South Africa amounted to 35% fo the total steel mass according to Telsnig 2015. The remaining steel is assumed to be sent to final disposal.
